1407540.name: Flying Things
1407540.description:
Flying Things is a first-person builder VR game that will accelerate your creativity!


For thousands of years, the biggest human dream was to fly and feel the birds' freedom. Leonardo da Vinci, George Cayley, or the third Wright brother? Enter our low-poly dreamland and become one of them, creating the best flying machine ever.



To make your plane move, you must move as well! Just pick some levers, reels, and do some pulling and spinning. It sure will do the work, but the question is - how motivated are you to beat your own records?

Acceleration is the key, but well... Without some wings, propellers, and a proper body, the challenge might get harder than you'd like it to be. Luckily, we have a garage filled with all the necessary plane parts (and friendly robots, ready to help whenever you would need them)! Decide which ones do you want to use and assemble them as you like!



Decorate it with colored sprays and additional parts if you want to see your artistic part taking over. To fly with style is to fly high!

Ready? Set? Go! Will you fly to another island? Or will you drown with your masterpiece?

Features

Build how you want
As a creator, you can mix and match the pieces without any restrictions.

Discover new possibilities
Use over 25 unique elements to construct your flying thing. You can use them in countless ways!

Set the new record
Fly to the farthest spot and beat your previous record! Feel the wind in the most immersive build-and-fly game to date.

Test many designs to find the best one
Improve your design or try all over again with a different concept. Ther is no fixed recipe for the perfect plane!



Objectives

Explore Flying Things garage and meet your little robotic helpers.

Match different parts and use some decorating to create your original vehicle.

Make your way through the ramp and fly as far as possible using both hands to accelerate the machine.

Upgrade your plane by applying a new design that will help you set another record.

Create your own tournaments and compete with friends and family.

No strings attached! No rules. The physics itself will verify your concept in action.
